title: Wednesday Dots : New Year
body_text:
Death is just the beginning. Star Wars - The Clone Wars, Season 6, Episode 12
Wednesday Dots: New Year
UW loses the Sun Bowl but looks to have a future star. And the UW Women’s Basketball team gets back-to-back road wins.
The end of 2024 will hopefully lead to a much better 2025 for the Huskies.
Football Dots
- A tough loss for the Huskies in the Sun Bowl. But as Raymond Lucas points out, Demond Williams Jr. gave us a glimpse of what we can expect in the future. In the Dawgman notes for the game, they noted that UW set the UW completion record for a team at .724, and that Will Rogers holds the individual completion percentage record at UW with .707. The Seattle Times has 3 impressions from the game including the huge game by Demond, the defense struggling, and concluding that it wasn’t a terrible season under the circumstances.
- In Jedd Fisch’s post-game press conference, he talked about what he expects in the future for Demond Williams, and how to get him to achieve that future:
we’re going to do everything we can to get him to New York City one day. And we’re going to do everything we can to get him a first-round pick. And to do that, I’m going to commit all of our resources and me to him and our staff. I know we’re going to surround him with great players
- You can watch the press conference here:
- Giles Jackson tied a UW single-game record with those 4 TD catches in the Sun Bowl, and Tony Castricone points out an similarity with the other game where that happened.
Watch each of the 4 TD catches, curtesy of the Big Ten Network:
- This was the last game for a number of seniors including Jacob Bandes who has now played in more games as a Husky than anyone else.
- It is being reported that UW is expected to host a potential transfer this week: CB Tacario Davis.
UW Athletics Dots
- UW Women’s Basketball player, Elle Landine, is named USBWA National Player of the Week after scoring 40 points last weekend against Northwestern.
And the team beat Illinois on the road, 84-75 to end the year with back-to-back wins.
- Softball America has a preview of the 2025 Husky Softball team ($).
- A snapshot of some of the best moments from UW athletics in 2024.
